finalStat: Maye: 25-of-34, 281 yards, 1 TD, 0 INT (did not hit over)

gameDetails.matchup: New York Jets @ New England Patriots

recentPerformance.hitRate: Maye averaging 2.4 pass TDs per game over last 5 starts
recentPerformance.recentForm: Jets allow 2.1 pass TDs/game (6th-worst in NFL)
recentPerformance.cushion: Maye threw 3 TDs vs this same Jets defense on Oct 20

keyFactors.title: Elite Recent TD Production
keyFactors.description: Drake Maye has thrown 2+ TDs in 4 of his last 5 starts, averaging 2.4 pass TDs per game. Rookie QB has been money in the red zone, completing 67% of passes inside the 20.

keyFactors.title: Jets' Pass Defense Weakness
keyFactors.description: Jets allow 2.1 passing TDs per game (6th-worst in NFL). Secondary depleted after trading CB DJ Reed to Miami. Rookie corners getting torched - QBs averaging 2.6 pass TDs vs NYJ over last 4 games.

keyFactors.title: Recent Success vs NYJ
keyFactors.description: Maye threw for 3 TDs vs this exact Jets defense on October 20 (Week 7). Familiarity with defensive scheme + Jets' personnel losses since that game = even better matchup.

keyFactors.title: Positive Game Script
keyFactors.description: Patriots favored by 12.5 points. When Patriots lead, Maye throws more (58% pass rate with lead vs 48% when trailing). Expected blowout = more red zone opportunities.

keyFactors.title: Red Zone Target Arsenal
keyFactors.description: Maye has elite red zone weapons: Hunter Henry (6'5" TE, 4 red zone TDs), Demario Douglas (slot weapon, 3 TDs), Kendrick Bourne (veteran WR, 2 TDs). Multiple scoring options increases TD probability.

riskFactors: Patriots could go run-heavy with Henderson if they get big lead
Thursday night short week = offensive inefficiency league-wide
Weather (40°F, 15mph winds) could reduce passing volume
Goal-line rushing TDs could vulture passing TD opportunities

gameFlow.q1: Maye 8-of-11, 94 yards, 1 TD (12-yard TD pass to Hunter Henry)
gameFlow.q2: Maye 7-of-9, 82 yards, 0 TD (Patriots scored on Henderson 2-yd rush TD)
gameFlow.q3: Maye 6-of-8, 67 yards, 0 TD (Patriots scored on field goal)
gameFlow.q4: Maye 4-of-6, 38 yards, 0 TD (Patriots scored on Henderson 1-yd rush TD)

redZoneBreakdown.trip1: Q1, 8:42 - Maye TD pass to Hunter Henry from 12 yards (PASSING TD ✓)
redZoneBreakdown.trip2: Q2, 3:15 - Henderson 2-yard rush TD (Maye handed off, no pass attempt)
redZoneBreakdown.trip3: Q2, 0:42 - Field goal, Maye incomplete on 3rd-and-goal from 8 yards
redZoneBreakdown.trip4: Q4, 6:21 - Henderson 1-yard rush TD (Maye handed off 3 straight plays)

gameResults.turningPoint: Patriots built 17-7 halftime lead and completely abandoned passing game in red zone. Henderson got 3 rushing TDs, all from inside the 3-yard line. Maye never got a chance to throw for 2nd TD despite moving ball efficiently between 20s.
gameResults.gamePace: Maye played great (25-of-34, 281 yards, 0 INT) but Patriots' game script went ultra-conservative. All 3 red zone trips after Q1 resulted in either run-heavy drives or FG. Maye moved ball beautifully but never threw in red zone again after opening TD.

whatWentWrong.title: Run-Heavy Red Zone Game Script
whatWentWrong.description: After building 17-7 halftime lead, Patriots abandoned passing in red zone entirely. Henderson got 3 rushing TDs from inside the 3-yard line. Maye had ZERO pass attempts in red zone after Q1.

whatWentWrong.title: Conservative Offensive Philosophy
whatWentWrong.description: Patriots went clock-killing mode early. Time of possession: 34:18 vs 25:42 (NYJ). Patriots ran 38 times vs 34 pass attempts. Bill Belichick-style conservative approach killed passing TD upside.

whatWentWrong.title: Henderson Goal-Line Vulture
whatWentWrong.description: Henderson's 3 rushing TDs came from 2 yards, 1 yard, 1 yard. All three drives featured Maye moving ball through air to get to red zone, then handing off. Classic TD vulture scenario.

whatWentWrong.title: Thesis Correct, Execution Wrong
whatWentWrong.description: Maye played EXACTLY as projected (281 yards, 73.5% completion, efficient). Problem: Patriots didn't need to throw in red zone due to blowout. Right player read, wrong game script read.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Maye averaged 2.4 pass TDs over last 5 games but got only 1 vs Jets (58% below recent form).
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Maye's 281 passing yards were ABOVE his season average (256.8 YPG). Efficiency was there, just not TDs.
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Needed 2 TDs, got 1 TD. Missed by 1 TD.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 1 passing TD = 32nd percentile for Maye's season (well below his typical output)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was NOT variance - this was wrong game script projection. The thesis on Maye's talent and Jets' pass defense was 100% correct (281 yards, 73.5% completion proves it). But we failed to account for Patriots' ultra-conservative philosophy in blowouts. When Patriots went up 17-7, they completely abandoned passing in red zone. Henderson got 3 goal-line rushing TDs that easily could've been Maye passing TDs in a competitive game. This is a lesson in betting props for teams that play conservative when leading. Maye was great, but game script killed passing TD upside.

closingLineValue.verdict: Excellent positive CLV (+10 cents). Line moved significantly toward Over as market hammered Maye. We got -115, closed at -125. Sharp money agreed with our Maye thesis - we captured great early value.

keyTakeaways: Game script kills passing TD props: Patriots went run-heavy after building lead, abandoning red zone passing
Positive CLV validates thesis: Got -115, closed at -125. Market agreed Maye was strong play
Belichick-style teams are pass TD prop killers: Conservative philosophy in blowouts = rushing TDs
Maye played great (281 yards) but volume wasn't there: Only 3 red zone pass attempts after Q1
Henderson's 3 rushing TDs vultured all passing TD opportunities from 1-2 yard line
verdict: Frustrating loss with correct process. Excellent CLV (+10 cents), Maye played phenomenally (281 yards, 0 INT, 102.4 rating), and Jets' pass defense was indeed vulnerable. But Patriots' ultra-conservative game script after building lead killed red zone passing volume. Henderson got 3 goal-line rushing TDs that easily could've been Maye passing TDs in competitive game. This is a sharp lesson: avoid passing TD overs for teams with conservative coaching philosophies (Belichick-style) when they're heavy favorites. Right player, right matchup, wrong situational awareness. Grade: B- (strong thesis, failed to account for game script risk)
